alert.note: Alert for Northern Carroll; Northern Coos; Northern Grafton; Southern Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 05 at 1:31PM EDT until April 06 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations up to an inch, sleet accumulations around one half an inch and ice accumulations between two tenths and four tenths. * WHERE...Portions of south central, west central, and western Maine. Portions of northern New Hampshire. * WHEN...Until 8 AM EDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Difficult travel conditions are possible due to icy road conditions after sunset tonight. Even light snowfall amounts can accumulate on roads and cause dangerous driving conditions due to snow covered roads. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday evening and Thursday morning commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Travel impacts will increase after sunset tonight and ice accretion increases.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org

area.areaDesc: Northern Carroll; Northern Coos; Northern Grafton; Southern Coos
